meanings.definition: A lottery in which participants buy numbered tickets to win a prize.
meanings.sent1: At the school fair, I entered the raffle to try and win a giant teddy bear.
meanings.sent2: My grandma won a TV in a raffle at the community center.
meanings.sent3: The raffle at the charity event had everyone excited to see who would win the big prize.
meanings.sent4: Participating in the raffle felt like a thrilling game of chance.
meanings.sent5: The colorful tickets for the raffle fluttered in the air as people eagerly awaited the drawing.

meanings.definition: To dispose of (goods) in a raffle.
meanings.sent1: The store decided to raffle off the extra inventory to make room for new products.
meanings.sent2: They raffled the old furniture to raise money for a local charity.
meanings.sent3: The company's creative marketing strategy was to raffle a limited edition item every month.
meanings.sent4: She decided to raffle her handmade crafts to share her talent with others.
meanings.sent5: The school club planned to raffle a gift basket filled with goodies at the upcoming event.

meanings.definition: A jumble or medley of things.
meanings.sent1: In the attic, there was a raffle of old toys and books piled up.
meanings.sent2: The garage sale had a raffle of items ranging from clothes to kitchenware.
meanings.sent3: The moving boxes contained a raffle of memories from different stages of life.
meanings.sent4: The artist's studio was a raffle of colors, brushes, and canvases.
meanings.sent5: The market stall displayed a raffle of fruits and vegetables, all fresh and vibrant.
